DataElement.preferredName: Southwest Oncology Group Patient Registration M Stage Eligibility Determination Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of M tumor stage that determines whether a Southwest Oncology Group (an NCI-sponsored cooperative group adult cancer clinical trials organization) subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according to specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Southwest Oncology Group Patient Registration M Stage Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to M stage (one criteria of the TMN staging system, where M refers to the presence of metastasis) and the act of determining if a Southwest Oncology Group (an NCI-sponsored cooperative group adult cancer clinical trials organization) subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according to specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) is an NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.:A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: An NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Southwest Oncology Group M Stage Eligibility Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of M tumor stage that determines whether a Southwest Oncology Group (an NCI-sponsored cooperative group adult cancer clinical trials organization) subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according to specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: separate Non-Small Cell Lung tumor nodule(s) in a contralateral lobe; tumor with pleural nodules or malignant pleural or pericardial effusion
Non-small cell lung tumor that has distant metastases

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
